result.execSummary:
The defendant Keith A. Long was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(>50g), a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)4.
  • Possess Methamphetamine Precursors, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.65.
  • Knowingly Possess Methamphetamine Waste, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.67(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: This judgment is for fines, court costs and restitution that you were ordered to pay through Dept of Corrections - if not paid during probation - or you get revoked  and have not paid in full - you will be required to pay to the Clerk of Courts any unpaid amount plus interest.

superAgency.notes: Deferred prosecution agreement with DA's office, subject to DEF not absconding or being revoked on Ct#2 or Ct #3.

judgments.dispoDesc: Deferred prosecution agreement with DA's office through 6-11-2017.  If DEF absconds or is revoked off probation on Ct #2 or Ct #3 judgment will be entered.

supervisions.notes: 10 years prison- 5 years initial confinement, 5 years extended supervision

superMiscConds.notes: Pay court costs $268.     If DE is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent.

Absolute Sobriety with Random Testing.  

Not to be on the premises of any establishment where primary source of income is from the sale of alcohol unless for the purposes of employment.   

Not to be on any property where illegal drugs are present.

judgments.dispoDesc:
Sentenced:  Deferred prosecution agreement revoked Ct #1:  Sentences:  10 years prison: 5 years initial confinement, 5 years extended supervision. DE has credit for 89 days.
Conditions of extended supervision:  Pay court costs $268 for Ct #1.  Absolute Sobriety with Random Testing.  Not to be on the premises of any establishment where primary source of income is from the sale of alcohol unless for the purposes of employment.   Not to be on any property where illegal drugs are present.    Complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Maintain employment.
judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:

Sentencing Hearing 11/29/17
Email correspondence:  Judge/Attorneys/DOC/Deputy Clerk of Court regarding correct disposition to only sentence for Count #1.

Defendant Keith A. Long in court with attorney Paul Max Moldenhauer.  Defendant Keith A. Long in custody.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both attorneys admit receipt of PSI.  DE states he went over PSI with counsel.  No objections or corrections.
ADA makes sentencing statement.  Atty Moldenhauer makes statement.   DE makes statement.
Court addresses the DE.
Deferred prosecution agreement revoked Ct #1:  Sentences:  10 years prison: 5 years initial confinement, 5 years extended supervision. DE has credit for 89 days.
Ct #1 and #2 both sentenced:  3 years prison- 1 year initial confinement, 2 years extended supervision both are concurrent with Ct #1. 
Conditions of extended supervision:  Pay court costs $268 for Ct #1.  Absolute Sobriety with Random Testing.  Not to be on the premises of any establishment where primary source of income is from the sale of alcohol unless for the purposes of employment.   Not to be on any property where illegal drugs are present.    Complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Maintain employment. 
Counts #2 & #3 same conditions, including paying any remaining financial balance from court costs of $268 that were originally ordered on each count. 

Remanded back to the custody of the Sheriff for transportation.

Defendant Keith A. Long in court, in custody, with attorney Martin Jarvis.  John M Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing as follows:
Ct #1:  Deferred judgment of conviction, in effect until 6-11-17, if DEF absconds or is revoked on Ct 2 or Ct 3 prior to that date, this count will come back for sentencing.
Ct #2:  Sentencing witheld, DEF ordered 3 years probation consecutive to Ct #3, with conditions   AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations,  No alcohol or drug use, complete any counseling, treatment and programs deemed appropriate by agent. Pay court costs $268.00
Ct #3:  Sentence imposed, DEF ordered to 4 years prison- one year of confinement and 3 years extended supervision concurrent with 12CF90, with 183 day credit for time served.  Conditions   AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations,  No alcohol or drug use, complete any counseling, treatment and programs deemed appropriate by agent, DEF to obtain GED/HSED by the end of the extended supervision.  Pay court costs $268.00
DEF is elibible for the Substance Abuse Program, but not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
